title: Earth Hour
summary: Earth Hour is a worldwide movement organized by the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF).  The event is held annually, encouraging individuals, communities, and businesses to turn off non-essential electric lights, for one hour, from 8:30 to 9:30Â p.m. on a specific day towards the end of March, as a symbol of commitment to the planet.[1] It was started as a lights-off event in Sydney, Australia, in 2007.
